# Recommended Books for Data Analytics in R

A selection of cutting-edge books focused on data science, machine learning, and practical data analysis with R. These titles emphasize the tidyverse, modeling, and modern techniques suitable for aspiring data scientists and analysts.

## `R for Data Science`

**By Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham (2017, 2nd ed. 2023)**  
The definitive guide to data science with R from the creators of the tidyverse. Free online, this book covers importing, tidying, transforming, visualizing, and modeling data using modern R tools. Perfect for beginners to intermediate users.  
*Key Topics:* Data wrangling with dplyr, visualization with ggplot2, modeling with tidymodels, and reproducible research.  
[Free Online Book](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) | [Print Version on O’Reilly](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/r-for-data-science/9781492097402/)

![](images/cover.png){width="300"}

## Hands-On Programming with R

**By Garrett Grolemund**  
Companion to "R for Data Science," this book dives into programming fundamentals with R. It teaches programming concepts through hands-on examples, ideal for those transitioning to R from other languages or learning serious programming.  
*Key Topics:* Variables, loops, functions, debugging, vectorized code, and best practices for writing clean R code.  
[O’Reilly Online](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/) | [Print Version](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/hands-on-programming-with/9781449359102/)

![](images/cover-1.png){width="300"}

## Tidy Modeling with R

**By Max Kuhn and Julia Silge**  
Comprehensive guide to statistical modeling using the tidyverse and tidymodels framework. Covers the full modeling process from data preparation to evaluation, with a focus on practical, reproducible results.  
*Key Topics:* Data splitting, preprocessing, model fitting (regression, classification), hyperparameter tuning, evaluation metrics, and deployment.  
[Official Website](https://www.tmwr.org/) | [Print Version on O’Reilly](https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/tidy-modeling-with/9781492096481/)

![](images/cover-01.png){width="300"}

## Deep Learning with R

**By François Chollet and J.J. Allaire**  
Introduces deep learning concepts using Keras and TensorFlow in R. Suitable for users familiar with R who want to explore neural networks and advanced ML techniques. Bridges R with Python-based tools.  
*Key Topics:* Neural network basics, convolutional neural networks (CNNs), recurrent neural networks (RNNs), computer vision, and natural language processing.  
[Online Book](https://keras.rstudio.com/) | [Print Version on Manning](https://www.manning.com/books/deep-learning-with-r)

![](images/718pmzi0+HL._AC_UF1000,1000_QL80_.jpg){width="300"}
